{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3397274,"name":"Tim English","username":"MisterTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mistertim/{size}/159893_2.png","created_at":"2024-06-10T17:59:33.515Z","cooked":"

We are trying to generate swerve code using the CTRE Swerve Code Generator and are unable to get past Steering Verification. When we run the test, all four steering motors run clockwise, that therefore all need inverting. BUT, when we press the four invert switches, the YES button is unresponsive.

If we don’t press the invert buttons and press YES to proceed, it won’t allow us to generate a project.

We are using Kracken motors with CanCoders and Phoenix 2.0 mounted to Mk4i.

We have updated vendodeps

Any ideas?

Thanks, Tim

Solved. CTRE support helped us find the problem – we were building the project onto a OneDrive, which is not supported.
